column4: how do i disable the DOCK/ DASH on the lefthand side of the screen and return to "normal ubuntu"?
i hate the giant DOCK/ DASH
I want to be able to right click the menu bar and add my own launcher like in the older version of ubuntu.
just run "sudo apt-get install gnome-session-failback" ??
i installed "gnome-session-fallback" and logged out and back in using it.  YAY!
but --- i don't have the ability to right click the menu and have a launcher bar
GNOME 3 is not GNOME 2, no matter which shell you use you won't have all the features from GNOME 2 you're used to...
i had to log out and log back in to get gnome-session-failback
you have to log out to activate it.
gnome-shell?  this has nothing to do with shells.
i'm trying to have a LAUNCHER BAR
uh? it has everything to do with shells.
like i used to .... i could right click and say "Add Launcher APplication"
unless you think "shell" is something else than we're discussing.
shell is a terminal with a problem CLI
prompt
that's a very reductive definition of "shell", so, no.
this has NOTHING to do with my "shell"
my shell is bash if you want to know
echo $SHELL
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_(computing) have fun
i'm talking about the fact that I can't right click on the bar at the top and add a launcher app.  like for Firefox or xterm...
GNOME-Shell is a shell. Unity is a shell. GNOME Fallback is a shell.
yes, you can't do that with GNOME 3 to my knowledge, although i'm not a GNOME user.
